title: New Windows Pytorch version throttles OpenMP
body_html:
We are using the experimental windows version of pytorch
#494
https://github.com/peterjc123/pytorch
via the anaconda package pytorch.version == 0.2.1, on windows 10, python 3.6

We experience that after importing torch, unrelated code (xgboost in our case), suddenly cannot fully utilize OpenMP. Here is a basic example showing some naive OPenMP code that suddenly gets 'throttled' to only one core after import torch is called
https://gist.github.com/aviolov/f3f836a2954fa63100ce02891eeb7bf7

We also did not / do not experience this issue if we downgrade to

conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch=0.1.12

The exact call that does this is loading the _C library in torch
torch::init.py:
40: from torch._C import *

I can't determine which of the exact .dll loaded is responsible.

We are using the experimental windows version of pytorch
#494
https://github.com/peterjc123/pytorch
via the anaconda package  pytorch.version == 0.2.1, on windows 10, python 3.6
We experience that after importing torch, unrelated code (xgboost in our case), suddenly cannot fully utilize OpenMP. Here is a basic example showing some naive OPenMP code that suddenly gets 'throttled' to only one core after import torch is called
https://gist.github.com/aviolov/f3f836a2954fa63100ce02891eeb7bf7
We also did not / do not experience this issue if we downgrade to


conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch=0.1.12


The exact call that does this is loading the _C library in torch
torch::init.py:
40: from torch._C import *
I can't determine which of the exact .dll loaded is responsible.
body:
We are using the experimental windows version of pytorch
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/494
https://github.com/peterjc123/pytorch
via the anaconda package  pytorch.version == 0.2.1, on windows 10, python 3.6

We experience that after importing torch, unrelated code (xgboost in our case), suddenly cannot fully utilize OpenMP. Here is a basic example showing some naive OPenMP code that suddenly gets 'throttled' to only one core after `import torch` is called
https://gist.github.com/aviolov/f3f836a2954fa63100ce02891eeb7bf7

We also did not / do not experience this issue if we downgrade to 
>> conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch=0.1.12

The exact call that does this is loading the _C library in torch 
torch::__init__.py:
40: from torch._C import *

I can't determine which of the exact .dll loaded is responsible.
